alert.note: Alert for Hall; Hamilton; Merrick (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 12:35AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hamilton, southwestern Merrick and eastern Hall Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1234 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alda, or 9 miles southwest of Grand Island, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. Radar is also showing weak rotation in this area, although the threat for a tornado is currently considered low. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... south Grand Island and Phillips. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 305 and 315. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central Nebraska.
